verses.verse: Blessed <S%H1288><s%> be the Lord <S%H3068><s%> my strength <S%H6697><s%>, which teaches <S%H3925><s%> my hands <S%H3027><s%> to war <S%H7128><s%>, and my fingers <S%H676><s%> to fight <S%H4421><s%>:

My goodness <S%H2617><s%>, and my fortress <S%H4686><s%>; my high tower <S%H4869><s%>, and my deliverer <S%H6403><s%>; my shield <S%H4043><s%>, and he in whom I trust <S%H2620><s%>; who subdues <S%H7286><s%> my people under me <S%H5971><s%>.
Lord <S%H3068><s%>, what is man <S%H120><s%>, that you take knowledge <S%H3045><s%> of him <S%H1121><s%>! or the son of man <S%H582><s%>, that you make account of him <S%H2803><s%>!
Man <S%H120><s%> is like <S%H1819><s%> to vanity <S%H1892><s%>: his days <S%H3117><s%> are as a shadow <S%H6738><s%> that passes away <S%H5674><s%>.
Bow <S%H5186><s%> your heavens <S%H8064><s%>, O Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and come down <S%H3381><s%>: touch <S%H5060><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%>, and they shall smoke <S%H6225><s%>.
Cast forth <S%H1299><s%> lightning <S%H1300><s%>, and scatter <S%H6327><s%> them <S%H7971><s%>: shoot out your arrows <S%H2671><s%>, and destroy them <S%H2000><s%>.

Send <S%H7971><s%> your hand <S%H3027><s%> from above <S%H4791><s%>; deliver <S%H6475><s%> me <S%H5337><s%>, and snatch me out of great <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>, from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of strange <S%H5236><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%>;
Whose mouth <S%H6310><s%> speaks <S%H1696><s%> vanity <S%H7723><s%>, and their right hand <S%H3225><s%> is a right hand <S%H3225><s%> of falsehood <S%H8267><s%>.

I will sing <S%H7891><s%> a new <S%H2319><s%> song <S%H7892><s%> unto you <S%H430><s%>, O God: upon a psaltery <S%H5035><s%> and a instrument of ten strings <S%H6218><s%> will I sing praises unto you <S%H2167><s%>.

It is he that gives <S%H5414><s%> salvation <S%H8668><s%> unto kings <S%H4428><s%>: who delivers <S%H6475><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> his servant <S%H5650><s%> from the hurtful <S%H7451><s%> sword <S%H2719><s%>.

Deliver <S%H6475><s%> me <S%H5337><s%>, and snatch me from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of strange <S%H5236><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%>, whose mouth <S%H6310><s%> speaks <S%H1696><s%> vanity <S%H7723><s%>, and their right hand <S%H3225><s%> is a right hand <S%H3225><s%> of falsehood <S%H8267><s%>:

That our sons <S%H1121><s%> may be as plants <S%H5195><s%> grown up <S%H1431><s%> in their youth <S%H5271><s%>; that our daughters <S%H1323><s%> may be as corner stones <S%H2106><s%>, polished <S%H2404><s%> after the likeness <S%H8403><s%> of a palace <S%H1964><s%>:

That our barns <S%H4200><s%> may be full <S%H4392><s%>, affording <S%H6329><s%> all manner of store <S%H2177><s%>: that our sheep <S%H6629><s%> may bring forth thousands <S%H503><s%> and ten thousands <S%H7231><s%> in our streets <S%H2351><s%>:

That our oxen <S%H441><s%> may be strong to labor <S%H5445><s%>; that there be no breaking in <S%H6556><s%>, nor going out <S%H3318><s%>; that there be no complaining <S%H6682><s%> in our streets <S%H7339><s%>.
Happy <S%H835><s%> is that people <S%H5971><s%>, that is in such a case <S%H3602><s%>: Yes <S%H835><s%>, happy is that people <S%H5971><s%>, whose God <S%H430><s%> is the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.
